description: Let‚Äôs talk about birthdays! Did you know there are many words we use when we talk about birthdays? What does ‚ÄúHappy belated birthday‚Äù mean? description: Improve your English vocabulary with these 16 words  that come from Japanese! description: We often use shapes to describe things. Common shapes include squares, circles, and triangles. description: What are you doing? Where are you going? When are you leaving? These are examples of some of the most common present progressive questions. description: Some first names in English can also mean something else. Sometimes, we use first names as verbs, nouns, or adjectives. How is this possible? description: Heteronyms are words that are spelled the same way but have different pronunciations and meanings. description: Cze≈õƒá, witam w EngVid! (Hello, and welcome to EngVid!) When learning English, Polish speakers face particular challenges, and I want to address several of them in this lesson. description: In this lesson, I will give you a list of words that have different spellings but all contain the same vowel sound: or. In British English, for example, we tend to make the R sound much less pronounced, even if it is in the spelling of the word. Also, the syllable or is pronounced more like aw. description: Are you 100% certain when to use I and when to use me in English? Which one is a subject pronoun and which one is an object pronoun? description: Homophones are words that are spelled differently but sound exactly the same. For example, ‚Äúthe red book‚Äù and ‚Äúthe read book‚Äù sound the same, but they mean completely different things. To understand the meaning of the word, you need to rely on context or spelling. There are hundreds of homophones in English, and in today‚Äôs lesson, I will teach you eight pairs of them, so 16 words in total. You will notice that each pair is made up of one past simple verb and one other word with a different function. I will teach you the difference between rode and road, passed and past, wore and war, blew and blue, threw and through, ate and eight, and made and maid. description: Homophones are words that have the same pronunciation but are written differently. To understand the meaning of the word, you need to rely on context or spelling. In today‚Äôs lesson, I will teach you eight sets of homophones. You will notice that each set is made up of one past participle and one word or more with a different function. A past participle is a word used with a past verb to express something that is passive. For example, in ‚Äúit was sent‚Äù, the word ‚Äúsent‚Äù is a past participle, and ‚Äúwas‚Äù is the verb. I will teach you the difference between won and one, heard and herd, taught and tot, bred and bread, sent, scent, and cent, been and bean, caught and cot, and grown and groan. description: Want to understand English people and their culture better? description: Today, we are looking at vocabulary that allows you to complain. description: Learn 11 slang words and phrases that are popular NOW. description: Have you noticed anything strange about short words beginning with W? Some of them (but not all) have a different vowel sound from words with a similar spelling. description: Should you say Can I, Could I, or May I? Learn exactly when to use each expression to ask questions politely in English. description: Do we say get mail or take mail? How about get a pill or take a pill? The verbs to get and to take can be easily misused because they seem so similar. description: Do you need some help with your English pronunciation? Today we are focusing on words ending in -ing and -ink. description: Improve your vocabulary and the way you speak by learning these English adjectives! Adjectives are words that modify nouns by describing a particular quality of something. description: To be or not to be? That is the question! In this lesson, I‚Äôll be covering all the forms of the most important verb in English ‚Äì the irregular verb to be. description: Want to improve your pronunciation and vocabulary at the same time? Learning the structure of your face, your mouth, and your neck will help you learn to pronounce the sounds of English. description: If you only write ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù to people on Facebook, you need this lesson! I‚Äôll teach you what you can say AFTER that! description: Apostrophes are used for many purposes in English writing. description: Money and prices are common topics of conversation in everyday life, whether you are at home, at work, or on vacation. description: Do you think English grammar is confusing? Ever wonder why can we say ‚Äúa dollar‚Äù but we can‚Äôt say ‚Äúa money‚Äù? Why can we say ‚Äúhouses‚Äù, but not ‚Äúfurnitures‚Äù?
